business.headline: Gold and silver rally continues: Buy now or wait for a dip?With gold and silver near record highs, investors face a choice between chasing momentum or waiting for pullbacks. Price levels, support zones, and timing will decide near-term returns for portfolios.

NPS, PF withdrawal rule changes: What you can take out and whenNPS and EPF withdrawal rules have changed, affecting how much money can be accessed and when. From early exits to emergency withdrawals, here is what subscribers should check now.
Muted start on Dalal Street as benchmark indices drift lowerThe S&P BSE Sensex was up marginally by 15.58 points to 83,643.27, while the NSE Nifty50 added 7.95 points to 25,740.25 as of 9:23 am.

BCCL IPO allotment today: What listing gains can investors expect?BCCL IPO: The public listing opened for subscription on January 9, 2026, and closed on January 13, 2026. Shares are scheduled to list on the BSE and NSE on January 16, 2026.

BCCL IPO allotment out: Check your status, listing date, and GMPBharat Coking Coal IPO saw extraordinary demand across all investor categories by the time bidding closed on January 13, 2026. BCCL IPO was subscribed 143.85 times overall.

Dalal Street's worst new year in a decade. Should investors worry?After being among the worst-performing major global markets in 2025, Dalal Street has continued to lag peers at the start of the new year, weighed down by global uncertainty and cautious investor sentiment.

That jerk will be gone soon: Trump slams Fed Chair Powell in Detroit speechUS President Donald Trump has repeatedly clashed with the Fed Chief over its rate strategy, pressing for faster cuts to boost growth and manufacturing. He argues that lower rates would supercharge investment and help ease pressure on consumers.

50% or 75%? How much US tariff could India face after Iran moveThe concern centres on a proposed 25% US tariff on nations maintaining commercial ties with Iran. While a 25% levy may appear manageable on its own, market participants fear it could be imposed over and above existing duties, taking the total tariff burden to as much as 75%.

EPS pensioners can now get digital life certificates at home for free: Here's howThe move is aimed at making life easier for elderly pensioners and those who find it difficult to visit banks, EPFO offices or use smartphones for the annual life certificate process.

Budget 2026: Can GST simplification and better logistics revive retail consumption?As Budget 2026 draws nearer, industry players believe that GST simplification and stronger logistics could play a big role in reviving consumer demand across cities and smaller towns.
Sensex closes 250 points lower, Nifty below 25,800; Trent down 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.48 points to close at 83,627.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.95 points to end at 25,732.30.

India's basmati exporters worry as political turmoil grips IranFor many years, Iran was among India's most important markets for agricultural products, especially basmati rice. However, protests against the country's leadership and growing external pressure have unsettled trade flows.

Blinkit drops 10-minute delivery branding as Centre steps in after gig strikeThis move comes weeks after delivery workers across platforms staged strikes in late December, raising issues around working conditions, delivery pressure and lack of social security.

Budget 2026: What do startups expect from the next policy push?Budget 2026 is approaching and so are the expectations of the startup sector, which is looking for deeper reforms and long-term policy support.

Housing demand in India cools: What it means for homebuyersAccording to the latest PropIndex report by Magicbricks, housing demand in major cities fell by nearly 9% during the October–December 2025 quarter, while the supply of homes available for sale increased by over 3% in the same period.

Sensex ends 250 points lower: Why stock market fell today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.48 points to close at 83,627.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.95 points to end at 25,732.30. Losses were broad-based, reflecting cautious positioning amid global uncertainty and domestic technical resistance.

BCCL IPO closes soon: What does GMP tell about expected listing gain?Incorporated in 1972, Bharat Coking Coal Limited is engaged in the production of coking coal, non-coking coal, and washed coal. The company is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Coal India Limited.

Budget 2026: NBFCs call for liquidity support, faster recovery and tax reliefExpectations are rising in the NBFC sector ahead of Budget 2026. Industry leaders are calling for policy measures such as better liquidity access, faster recovery norms and tax relief to sustain lending momentum.

Eternal share price jumps 4% today: What's driving the rally?The stock jumped around 4% in early trade, and by midday was trading at approximately Rs 292.20, up 2.44%, as sentiment strengthened around the company's growth prospects.

Will Budget 2026 prioritise personal income tax cuts?As Budget 2026 approaches, expectations are rising around personal income tax relief. With consumption slowing and middle-class pressure growing, the key question is whether the government will ease tax burdens or stay fiscally cautious.

entertainment.headline: Emraan Hashmi shares why Awarapan 2 took 19 years to happen Emraan Hashmi revealed the reasons behind the nearly two-decade delay of Awarapan 2 and discussed recent security measures on set following leaked images.

Viral Toxic teaser actor Beatriz Taufenbach deletes Instagram after backlash Complaints from political and social groups have emerged over alleged graphic content in the teaser for Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-Ups, prompting official action and social media fallout.

Tom Hiddleston shares the first Indian film he watched. Hint: it's SRK's Tom Hiddleston recently revealed his Bollywood side, naming the first Indian film he watched. The actor returned as Jonathan Pine in the second season of The Night Manager.

Matt Damon's wife had a crush on Ben Affleck after watching Good Will Hunting Actor Matt Damon has shared that long before he and Luciana Barroso became a couple, she considered Ben Affleck 'the cute one' before marriage.

Malaika Arora addresses trolling, says item songs made her feel empowered at 52 Malaika Arora said she felt empowered by doing item songs and refused to apologise for the image she had built over the years, despite facing trolling.

Salman Khan, MS Dhoni, AP Dhillon bond over ATV adventure at Panvel farmhouse Singer AP Dhillon, actor Salman Khan and cricketer MS Dhoni were seen enjoying an off-road ATV adventure at Salman Khan's Panvel farmhouse. A video from the outing revealed the trio stuck in mud, but in good spirits.

Nikki Glaser: The roast queen Hollywood didn't know it needed Comedienne Nikki Glaser has refreshed Hollywood award nights with sharp, honest humour, making once-predictable shows feel engaging and warm again. She recently made her comeback as the host of the 83rd Golden Globe Awards.

Danish Pandor calls Dhurandhar's Middle East ban unwarranted, says it is subjective Danish Pandor addressed the film's Middle Eastern ban and praised co-stars Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna for their inspiring performances.

Salman Khan steals the spotlight at Nupur-Stebin Ben's Mumbai reception. Watch Salman Khan attended Stebin Ben and Nupur Sanon's Mumbai wedding reception on Tuesday. The singer bowed down to Salman Khan as he wished him and Nupur on their union.

Toxic, Parasakthi, Jana Nayagan: 3 controversies and a South storm brewing Three major South Indian films face controversies involving censorship, politics, and morality. The disputes highlight growing tensions as elections approach and cinema intersects with political agendas.

Trevor Noah to host Grammys 2026 for sixth and final time Trevor Noah will return to host the 2026 Grammy Awards for a sixth and final time, marking the end of his celebrated run as the face of music's biggest night.

How Yami Gautam's Haq chooses justice and reason over faith-bashing Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's Haq revisited the Shah Bano case without bashing faith. The film narrated the real-life court case, and at the same time questioned patriarchy and power.

Katy Perry, Orlando Bloom step out together for family outing months after split Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom were seen reuniting for a low-key family outing in Santa Barbara, months after their separation, showing their continued commitment to co-parenting their daughter Daisy.

BTS announce massive 2026–2027 world tour; India not announced in first list BTS have officially announced their 2026–2027 world tour, marking their first full-scale global tour since returning as a complete group after military service and solo projects.

Nick Jonas links viral stepping out moment at Golden Globes to new song Gut Punch Nick Jonas addressed a viral moment from the 2026 Golden Globe Awards with honesty after being seen stepping outside during the ceremony, linking it to emotional vulnerability and his new song Gut Punch.

Priyanka Chopra shares fun BTS pics with Blackpink's Lisa from Golden Globes night Priyanka Chopra Jonas shared the behind-the-scenes pictures with Blackpink's Lisa from the 2026 Golden Globe Awards, where the duo presented an award together.

Adolescence co-creator Stephen Graham confirms Season 2 after Golden Globes win Stephen Graham confirmed that he and co-creator Jack Thorne are working on the second season of 'Adolescence'. The show won four major awards at Golden Globes 2026.

Haq director Suparn Varma thanks Alia, Kiara and Karan Johar for praising his film Haq director Suparn Varma reacted to Alia Bhatt, Kiara Advani and Karan Johar's praise for his film. The film features Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi in key roles.

Avengers Doomsday new teaser: Wakandans team up with the Fantastic Four The new teaser of 'Avenger: Doomsday' shows the 'Fantastic Four' and 'Black Panther' crossover. The film is directed by Russo Brothers.

general news.headline: 'Constant confusion' over CM issue, Siddaramaiah seeks clarity from Rahul GandhiKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has requested a meeting with Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and seeking his clarity on the leadership tussle in the state, asserting there was "constant confusion" on the issue, sources told India Today TV.

12 killed after construction crane collapse derails train in ThailandLocal police said the crane was working on a high-speed rail project when it collapsed and crashed onto the passing train. The incident caused the carriage to derail and catch fire.

50% or 75%? How much US tariff could India face after Iran moveThe concern centres on a proposed 25% US tariff on nations maintaining commercial ties with Iran. While a 25% levy may appear manageable on its own, market participants fear it could be imposed over and above existing duties, taking the total tariff burden to as much as 75%.

Trump warns Iran against executing protesters, Tehran calls him main killer  Live updatesWithout offering specifics, President Donald Trump said that the US would take "very strong action" if Iran began executing protesters. "If they hang them, you're going to see some things," he said.

Palak paneer and prejudice: Indian students win Rs 1.8 crore lawsuit in USIndian PhD students Aditya Prakash and Urmi Bhattacheryya also argued that departmental kitchen rules at the University of Colorado Boulder singled out South Asians, discouraging community members from opening their lunches in common areas.

Video: Trump gives middle finger to heckler who called him paedophile protectorUS President Donald Trump was caught on video responding angrily to a heckler during a Ford factory tour in Michigan. The incident has sparked debate over his reaction amid renewed scrutiny of his links to Jeffrey Epstein.

Victim missing, case falls apart, but cops under pressure to frame Sheikh HasinaAn "attempted murder" case in Bangladesh naming ousted PM Sheikh Hasina and 112 others has collapsed after investigators failed to trace the alleged victim or verify any core claims in the complaint. Even as the police are now seeking to drop the charges, they said they were under "pressure" to continue with the case. This substantiates what Hasina's Awami League said were "ghost cases" and the political pressure on law enforcement officers in the Yunus regime.

I don't know how he's alive: Robert Kennedy Jr describes Trump's dietUS Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr said Trump eats healthy at home but relies on fast food while traveling, dismissing health concerns as the president faces scrutiny over age, stamina and diet.

How Yami Gautam's Haq chooses justice and reason over faith-bashingYami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi's Haq revisited the Shah Bano case without bashing faith. The film narrated the real-life court case, and at the same time questioned patriarchy and power.

Mass dog killings rock Telangana, 500 killed in 1 week to fulfill 'poll promise'As many as 500 dogs have been poisoned to death in Telangana's Kamareddy and Hanamkonda districts in an alleged bid to fulfill a promise made during the recent gram panchayat elections to tackle the stray dog menace.

Minimal impact: What Centre said on Trump's 25% tariffs on Iran tradeIran's major import partners include the UAE at $21 billion (30 per cent), China at $17 billion (26 per cent), Turkiye at $11 billion (16 per cent) and the European Union at $6 billion (9 per cent), underscoring India's relatively marginal share.

T20 World Cup: Visas denied to Pakistan-origin USA players? Here's the truthPakistani-origin USA players are facing visa delays ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026 hosted by India and Sri Lanka. However, there have been widespread reports claiming their visas have been denied.

Confident India target ODI series win in Rajkot despite injury concernsThe Indian side will look to seal yet another white-ball series and avoid further injury concerns when they take on New Zealand in the second ODI at the Niranjan Shah Stadium in Rajkot on Wednesday.

Live: Russia defends ally Iran, says US threats are 'subversive external interference'Iran Protests Live Updates: The death toll from nationwide protests in Iran surged to at least 2,403 on Wednesday as Iranians were able to make phone calls abroad for the first time in days after authorities cut communications during a sweeping crackdown. The protests, which began more than two weeks ago over the country's struggling economy, have since broadened into direct opposition to the ruling theocracy, including Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Iranian state television issued its first indirect acknowledgement of the scale of the deaths, saying the country had suffered a lot of martyrs. While US President Donald Trump urged Iranians to keep protesting, saying help was on the way. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

What H-1B visa-holders can expect in 2026 and who stands to lose mostAfter a chaotic 2025, the new year is shaping up to be an uncertain one for H-1B visa-holders and applicants. New US rules, including higher fees, wage-based lotteries and tougher background checks, under President Trump could further restrict visas unless American courts step in to block them.

Five states, same story: How private hospitals gamble with patients' livesThe moment a patient is admitted, billing begins, often leaving families paying hefty sums despite inadequate care and unnecessary medication. India Today investigated such allegations through ground reports from Greater Noida, Ranchi, Munger, Bhopal and Lucknow.

Toxic, Parasakthi, Jana Nayagan: 3 controversies and a South storm brewingThree major South Indian films face controversies involving censorship, politics, and morality. The disputes highlight growing tensions as elections approach and cinema intersects with political agendas.

Zohran Mamdani, Trump exchanging friendly texts in budding bromance: ReportNew York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani and US President Donald Trump surprised the world with their friendly meeting at the White House in November last year.

Revenge of the Desert: How Mahmud Ghazni nearly fell after the Somnath plunderThis article is the first installment in our series, exploring how the powerful empire built by Mahmud Ghazni in Central Asia sowed the seeds of its own destruction.
The world's strongest passports list is out. India ranks…The Henley Passport Index 2026 has ranked India at the 80th spot, five places higher than last year.

Lone Spanish satellite survives PSLV-C62's failure, sends data from spaceThe 25-kg football-sized prototype, launched as a co-passenger on January 12, separated "against all odds" from the rocket's fourth stage.

Taunted over dark skin: Mother alleges harassment after Bengaluru student's deathA Bengaluru dental college faces scrutiny after police registered an FIR against four professors and the principal, in connection with the suicide of a student who was reportedly subjected to harassment and humiliation over her skin colour.

UK MPs raise security fears over China's mega embassy in LondonUK lawmakers raised security alarms over China's proposed mega embassy in London, warning of espionage risks as Prime Minister Keir Starmer moves toward approving the project ahead of a Beijing visit.

Sudden onset of dense fog in Delhi-NCR, AQI at 360; airport issues advisoryA sudden onset of dense fog shrouded Delhi and its adjoining areas on Wednesday morning, cutting visibility, as the AQI remained in the very poor category at 360. The airport issued an advisory for low visibility procedures.

sports.headline: WPL 2026: Meg Lanning set for emotional reunion as Capitals, Warriorz seek redemption WPL 2026, DC vs UPW: Meg Lanning is all set for an emotional reunion with the Delhi Capitals as UP Warriorz look to bounce back following back-to-back defeats in the competition.

Multiple injuries ring alarm bells for India's T20 World Cup title defence at home India's preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026 face hurdles due to injuries to key players namely Tilak Varma and Washington Sundar. The unforeseen injuries have hampered India's preparedness ahead of their title defence at home.

Tennis player forgets tie-break rules, celebrates early and suffers crushing loss Sebastian Ofner's early celebration backfired in stunning fashion as Nishesh Basavareddy staged a dramatic comeback to win a chaotic Australian Open qualifier tiebreak 13–11.

IND vs NZ Live: Focus on Rohit, Kohli as India eye series win in Rajkot India (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ), 2nd ODI Live score: India will take on New Zealand in the second ODI at the Niranjan Shah Cricket Stadium in Rajkot with the aim of sealing the series. The Men in Blue are leading 1-0 after a four-wicket win in Vadodara.

Grace Hayden on her dad's gamble on Joe Root, India connection and foray into tennis Grace Hayden talks about her father Matthew Hayden's risky Joe Root bet, the overwhelming love she receives from Indian fans, and why she's excited to step beyond cricket and into the world of tennis broadcasting.

Fit and fierce PV Sindhu targets World Championships, Asian Games in 2026 India's star shuttler PV Sindhu has returned to full fitness. Sindhu made a tremendous return to Malaysia Masters, the first competition of the season, and is now ready for a long series which includes the World Championships and Asian Games.

T20 World Cup: Visas denied to Pakistan-origin USA players? Here's the truth Pakistani-origin USA players are facing visa delays ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026 hosted by India and Sri Lanka. However, there have been widespread reports claiming their visas have been denied.

Henry Nicholls backs inexperienced New Zealand side to bounce back in Rajkot New Zealand batter Henry Nicholls has backed their inexperienced side to bounce back in the second ODI against India in Rajkot. The Kiwis lost the first match by four wickets and are trailing by 0-1 in three-match series.

Confident India target ODI series win in Rajkot despite injury concerns The Indian side will look to seal yet another white-ball series and avoid further injury concerns when they take on New Zealand in the second ODI at the Niranjan Shah Stadium in Rajkot on Wednesday.

India to revise ODI batting template after T20 World Cup: Batting coach India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said the team would need to revise its ODI batting template after the T20 World Cup in March, especially in light of the new rule that brings in a second ball after the 34th over. As per the change in playing conditions, bowling teams have to pick any one of the two balls to continue bowling from overs 35-50.

MI vs GG: Harmanpreet Kaur becomes first Indian to reach 1000 runs in WPL history Harmanpreet Kaur became the first Indian cricketer to cross the 1,000-run mark in the Women's Premier League, producing a commanding knock to lead the Mumbai Indians to yet another victory over the Gujarat Giants.

Harmanpreet Kaur haunts Gujarat again as Mumbai Indians make it 8-0 against GiantsWPL 2026, MI vs GG: Harmanpreet Kaur scored an unbeaten 71 as Mumbai Indians beat the Gujarat Giants by seven wickets on Tuesday after chasing down 193 with four balls to spare at the DY Patil Stadium.

Pakistan-born USA pacer claims India visa denied ahead of T20 World Cup: ReportUSA fast bowler Ali Khan has claimed his Indian visa application has been denied less than a month before the ICC Men's T20 World Cup begins, adding a fresh layer of uncertainty to the Americans' preparations for the tournament.

Arbeloa reveals Alonso wished him well after he became Real Madrid's new managerÁlvaro Arbeloa said Xabi Alonso reached out to wish him well after his appointment as Real Madrid manager, underlining that their friendship remains strong despite their new roles.

Who is Ayushi Soni? Gujarat Giants batter becomes first to be retired out in WPLAyushi Soni made WPL history by becoming the first batter to be retired out, a tactical move that helped Gujarat Giants post 192 against Mumbai Indians in Women's Premier League 2026.

IND vs NZ, 2nd ODI: Predicted XI: Will Gautam Gambhir hand Ayush Badoni ODI debut?IND vs NZ, 2nd ODI: Ayush Badoni could make his debut in the Rajkot ODI, after batting coach Sitanshu Kotak explained that India included her to provide an additional bowling option alongside their existing five bowlers.

No communication breakdown between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli: Batting coachIND vs NZ: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak has dismissed rumours of a communication breakdown between senior batters Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma and head coach Gautam Gambhir, insisting the team remains fully focused on its World Cup preparations.

India Open pigeon free: Badminton body rebuffs Danish shuttler's hygiene complaintIndia Open 2026: Badminton Association of India general secretary Sanjay Mishra clarified that hygiene complaints were about the training hall, not the main arena, after Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt flagged unhealthy warm-up conditions at the India Open on Tuesday.

England do not have a drinking problem: Broad dismisses Ashes tour criticismFormer England seamer Stuart Broad has insisted that the current England team do not have a drinking problem, despite a series of alcohol-related incidents over the winter in the Ashes.

India coach backs Ayush Badoni's ODI selection: No team goes in with five bowlersIndia batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said Ayush Badoni was picked for the remaining ODIs to add bowling depth after Washington Sundar's injury, stressing India cannot risk playing with a five-bowler attack.

Lakshya Sen weaponises familiarity to spoil Ayush Shetty's India Open debutYoung Indian shuttler Ayush Shetty endured a forgettable outing at the India Open Super 750 as he bowed out in the opening round against former champion and training partner Lakshya Sen.

Ayush Badoni-less Delhi knocked out as Vidarbha reaches semisVidarbha booked their place in the Vijay Hazare Trophy semi-finals for the second consecutive season with a 76-run victory over a depleted Delhi side. Delhi's campaign ended at the quarter-final stage as they struggled in the absence of Ayush Badoni, who was on national duty, and the injured skipper Rishabh Pant.

MI vs GG Highlights: MI (193/3 in 19.2 ov), Mumbai end Gujarat's unbeaten runMumbai Indians Women (MI) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GG) Highlights: Harmanpreet Kaur has hit a superb fifty to help Mumbai Indians chase down their highest-ever WPL target and make it eight out of eight wins against Gujarat Giants.

Punjab storm into semifinals with comprehensive win over MPPunjab stormed into the semifinals of the Vijay Hazare Trophy with a commanding all-round display, thrashing Madhya Pradesh by 183 runs. The top order laid a solid foundation with the bat before the bowlers completed a clinical rout to seal Punjab's place in the last four.

Denmark shuttler unhappy with conditions, cleanliness in DelhiIndia Open 2026: Denmark's Mia Blichfeldt criticised playing conditions at IG Stadium, saying the venue change has done little to improve what she called unhealthy and unprofessional surroundings, and urged the BWF to step in ahead of the World Championships.

Proud Mitchell Starc reacts as Alyssa Healy announces Australia retirementMitchell Starc expressed pride as Alyssa Healy announced her retirement, closing the curtain on a trophy-laden Australia career. Healy will retire after Australia's home series against India.

Manchester United agree deal with Carrick to take charge until end of seasonManchester United have agreed a deal in principle with former midfielder Michael Carrick to join the club as their interim manager until the end of the 2025-26 season.

Joburg Super Kings captain Faf du Plessis ruled out of SA20 due to injuryFaf du Plessis, captain of the Joburg Super Kings, has been ruled out of the rest of the SA20 season following a thumb injury sustained during the match against MI Cape Town on January 10.

Gujarat Giants look to extend winning streak against old foes Mumbai IndiansGujarat Giants look to continue their winning streak against Mumbai Indians in WPL 2026. The match promises a thrilling contest with Mumbai's perfect record against Gujarat at stake.

T20 World Cup: Bangladesh reiterates it won't play in India in latest meeting with ICCBangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has reiterated that it won't play in India for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 in the latest meeting with the International Cricket Council (ICC). The ICC held a special meeting with the BCB to discuss the matter amid growing tensions between the BCB and the BCCI.

Watch: Sachin Tendulkar vs Amitabh Bachchan in hand-cricket battle, here's who wonSachin Tendulkar and Amitabh Bachchan shared a fun game of hand cricket during the ISPL event. The light-hearted exchange between the two legends quickly went viral and delighted fans online.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
